messages.noExams: There are no exams associated with your account.
messages.noExamsMatchingCriteria: There are no exams matching this criteria.
messages.no-results-found: No test results are available for the current selection.  If a new school year has begun recently, please check the year selected above.
messages.noExamsSelected: Please select from the assessments above

access-denied.title: Access Denied
access-denied.message: Your user account is not permitted to access this reporting system. If you believe you have reached this page in error, please contact your building administrator.

messages.no-item-level-data: Item level data is not available for tests administered prior to 2017-18 school year.
messages.unknown-error: An unknown error has occurred. You can try the same action again or click the button below to go to the home page.  If this problem persists, please contact your building administrator.

welcome.title: Welcome!
welcome.user-guide-html: The User Guide describes features of the Smarter Balanced Reporting System and instructions for using each feature.
welcome.interpretive-guide-html: The Interim Assessments Interpretive Guide is designed to help educators, parents, and other stakeholders interpret interim assessments reports for the Smarter Balanced Reporting System.

groups.name: My Groups
groups.no-groups-message: Contact your building administrator for access to group-level test results.
groups.empty-message: There are no groups that match your search.  Please try again.

results.null-group: This group is unavailable.  Contact your building administrator if you think you should have access to this group.
results.title: Results

adv-filters.label: Advanced Filters
adv-filters.subhead: Click an item to remove it from the list
adv-filters.instruct: Click an item to add or remove it from your list of selections above.

test.label: Test
test.off-grade-assessment-info: Schools may administer interim assessments for any grade.  This filter indicates that a student took an assessment for a grade other than their assigned grade.

status.label: Status
status.administration-info: For interim assessments, a Standardized administration follows the same protocols and security procedures as a summative test administration. For a Non Standardized administration, the teacher may use the assessment during instruction and interact with students as they complete the assessment.
status.summative-info: For summative assessments, a test is noted as invalid if an appeal is submitted  to invalidate the test due to a test irregularity or breach.
status.completion-info: Indicates whether the test was completed or was partially complete.

student.label: Student
student.migrant-status-info: A child is considered "migratory" if the parent or guardian is a migratory worker in the agricultural, dairy, lumber, or fishing industries and the child's family has moved during the past three years. A young adult may also qualify if he or she has moved on his or her own for the same reasons.
student.504-plan-info: Indicates that a student has an approved 504 plan.  These plans are for students with disabilities who may need accommodations but do not require specialized instruction.
student.iep-info: Indicates that a student has an approved Individual Education Plan (IEP).  These plans are for students with disabilities who require specialized instruction.
student.economic-disadvantage-info: Indicates that a student qualifies for free or reduced lunch or meets other state criteria for economic disadvantage.
student.limited-english-proficiency-info: Students who use a language other than English as their primary language and who have been assessed as not possessing the English language skills necessary to succeed in the regular instructional program.

results.selected-assessments-instruct: Click an assessment to remove it from the list

select-assessments.instruct: Click an assessment to add or remove it from your list of selections above.

assessment.sessions-instruct: Toggle a session to include or exclude it from the results.

exams.title: Results By Student
exams.empty-message: No test results are available for the sessions and advanced filters selected.

cols.name: Student
cols.status-info: Refers to whether an assessment has been flagged as standardized/nonstandardized, complete/partial, and valid/invalid.
cols.score-info: A student's test score and an error band based on the Standard Error of Measurement (SEM) associated with that score.  Smarter Balanced test scores are on a vertical scale, meaning that scores for all grades are reported on a single continuous scale to reflect the increased expectations as students advance through the grades.  The error band is included because test scores are estimates of student achievement and come with a certain amount of measurement error. See the Interpretive Guide for additional information about scale scores and measurement error.

iab.performance-info: Student scores on each Interim Assessment Block are assigned to one of three reporting categories (Below Standard, Near Standard, Above Standard).  The standard is based on the minimum scale score for the 'Met Standard' achievement level on the Interim Comprehensive and summative assessments (the score that separates Levels 2 and 3).  See the Interpretive Guide for more information on how placement into the reporting categories is determined.

ica.performance-info: Student scores on the Summative and Interim Comprehensive assessments are assigned to one of four achievement levels (Standard Not Met, Standard Nearly Met, Standard Met, and Standard Exceeded) based on the scale score.

cols.claim-info-html: Claims and targets are a way of classifying test content. The claim is the major topic area. For example, in English language arts, reading is a claim. Within each claim, there are targets that describe the particular knowledge and skills that the test measures. Each target may encompass one or more standards from the Common Core State Standards. Within the Reading claim, for example, one of the targets is concerned with finding the central idea in a text. For more information, see the Smarter Balanced Content Specifications.
cols.difficulty-info: Item difficulty (easy, moderate, difficult) is based on the difficulty of the item for students in a reference population.  See the Interpretive Guide for a description of the reference population and how the difficulty categories are derived.

standard-info-html.ELA: This column reflects the Common Core State Standard(s) associated with a test item. Test items may be associated with more than one standard. For example, a question that asks students to evaluate research sources may assess both reading and research skills. For more information, see the English Language Arts Content Specifications.
standard-info-html.MATH: This column reflects the Common Core State Standard(s) associated with a test item. Test items may be associated with more than one standard. Items that assess mathematical practices (problem solving, modeling and data analysis, and communicating reasoning) are also aligned to standards that describe the mathematical content with which students engage. For example, an item may ask students to communicate their reasoning when solving a problem about geometry or fractions. For more information, see the Mathematics Content Specifications.

cols.full-credit-info: Percentage of students in the group who earned the maximum number of points available for a particular test item.

tabs.student-scores-intro-text: Expand each student row to view their response to this item.
tabs.item-viewer-intro-text: This is the view of the item as seen while taking the assessment.
tabs.item-viewer-response-not-included: This does not include student responses.
tabs.item-viewer-see-rubric: See the Rubric and Exemplar tab to get more information on correct responses.

errors.not-found: The rubric and exemplar are not available.
errors.unknown: Error trying to load rubrics and exemplars

assessments.average-scale-score-info: Average scale score for the selected group of students and an error band based on the Standard Error of the Mean (SEM) associated with that score. Test scores are estimates of student achievement and come with a certain amount of measurement error. See the Interpretive Guide for additional information about scale scores and measurement error.

menus.resources-disabled-message: Instructional resources are not yet available for this assessment.

messages.no-grades-available: No test results are available for the selected school.
messages.null-school: This school is unavailable.  Contact your building administrator if you think you should have access to this school.

messages.no-results: Student does not exist or has no available test results.
messages.null-student: This student is unavailable.  Contact your building administrator if you think you should have access to this student.

cols.correctness-info: A value for the degree of correctness in a student's response to a test question. The correctness value is calculated by dividing the student's score on a particular question by the maximum score for that question.

reports.heading: My Reports
reports.no-reports-html: To create a report, first select a group or school from the Home page. Next click the "Student Reports" button to get started.

status.title: A status indicator will be displayed if the report generation was not successful or the report has expired.

accommodations.title: Student Accommodations
accommodations.info: This feature allows student reports that may be shared with colleges and universities or other external organizations to be printed without reference to accommodations.

messages.get-reports-error: There was an unexpected error while getting your reports. Please click the button below to reload the page and try again.
messages.download-failed: There was an unexpected error while getting this report. Please try again.

organization-tree.subheader-not-empty: Click an item to remove it from the list

organization.label: Search for a District, School or Institution

submit.label: Export Results
submit.failure: Error creating export. Please try again.

ethnicity.DemographicRaceTwoOrMoreRaces: Demographic Race of Two or More

1-IT.name: Read Analytically: Informational Text
1-IT.description: Read Analytically: Informational Text - Students can read closely and analytically to comprehend a range of increasingly complex literary and informational texts.

1-LT.name: Read Analytically: Literary Text
1-LT.description: Read Analytically: Literary Text - Students can read closely and analytically to comprehend a range of increasingly complex literary and informational texts.

2-W.name: Write Effectively
2-W.description: Write Effectively - Students can produce effective and well-grounded writing for a range of purposes and audiences.

3-L.name: Listen Purposefully
3-L.description: Speak and Listen purposefully - Students can employ effective speaking and listening skills for a range of purposes and audiences.

3-S.name: Speak Purposefully
3-S.description: Speak and Listen purposefully - Students can employ effective speaking and listening skills for a range of purposes and audiences.

4-CR.name: Conduct Research
4-CR.description: Conduct Research - Students can engage in research/ inquiry to investigate topics and to analyze, integrate, and present information.

1.name: Concepts and Procedures
1.description: Concepts and Procedures - Students can explain and apply mathematical concepts and interpret and carry out mathematical procedures with precision and fluency.

2.name: Problem Solving
2.description: Problem Solving - Students can solve a range of complex well-posed problems in pure and applied mathematics, making productive use of knowledge and problem solving strategies.

3.name: Communicating Reasoning
3.description: Communicating Reasoning - Students can clearly and precisely construct viable arguments to support their own reasoning and to critique the reasoning of others.

4.name: Modeling and Data Analysis
4.description: Modeling and Data Analysis - Students can analyze complex, real-world scenarios and can construct and use mathematical models to interpret and solve problems.

1.description: Make sense of problems and persevere in solving them

3.description: Construct viable arguments and critique the reasoning of others

7.description: Look for and make use of structure

8.description: Look for and express regularity in repeated reasoning
